text: The European Parliament election of 1995 in Sweden was the election of Members of the European Parliament representing the Sweden constituency for the 1995–1999 term of the European Parliament. Austria, Finland and Sweden acceded to the Union on 1 January 1995. 59 delegates (21 from Austria, 16 from Finland, 22 from Sweden) were appointed to the Parliament on accession, bringing the total up to 626. Elections to elect the 22 MEPs for Sweden were held on 17 September 1995Val-och-valdeltagande on the EU Upplysningen website from the Swedish Parliamenteng_faktablad_4_080206_webb.pdf on the EU Upplysningen website from the Swedish Parliament and the now-elected MEPs took their seats with effect from 9 October 1995.European Parliament Information Office in Sweden page on former members ==Results by group== The map shows which European party group received the most votes in each municipality The results by political group of the Sweden election were as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Group !colspan="2"|Before election 16 September 1995 !Election 17 September 1995 !colspan="2"|After election 9 October 1995 !See also |- |bgcolor=#FF0000| ||PES |11 | * Birgitta Ahlqvist;
